cells.data:
Problem: Show that $L = \{ a^n : n \text{ is composite} \}$ is not regular.

Proof:

Regular languages are closed under several properties, including complementation. Thus, $\text{reg}(L) \iff \text{reg}(\overline{L})$.

But now let us examine $\overline{L}$: this would be the set of strings $\{ a^n : n \text{ is prime} \}$, already shown in this class to be non-regular.

Thus $L$ cannot be regular. $\diamond$
